Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: WeMichaelDanny
Reviews.Content: Price was right, staff was great. Clean and quiet. Less than fifteen minutes from downtown. Not one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: HKicks311
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long flight and before we had to leave the next day to drive to Cincinnati. This was a fine place to stay for the low cost. Room was nothing special, but was certainly sufficient. Water pressure in shower was good. The bed was also pretty nice. It wasn't as hard as a rock like some of the lower budget hotels. Free breakfast was perfect, cereal, yogurt, fruit, bagels, muffins, etc. Breakfast staff was very nice. Plenty of parking (also free). Easy to find from the airport. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For......And That Is Fine!”
Reviews.Author: bonvivantmeg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while passing through Indianapolis. It is an older hotel and well used but completely harmless. The beds aren't 5-star quality but nor do they claim to be. The halls and room did smell a little musky but nothing unbearable. For $65/night its a great deal. Quick access to Indianapolis without being on a loud/busy road. I didn't use the airport but heard this is a great hotel for that too, they do offer a shuttle, I believe free of charge. Free parking which is nice, decent continental breakfast. Again, you get what you pay for, bargain prices=bargain hotel. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: osumom31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for a bowling tournament. Room was clean. Staff friendly. Close to plenty of food and stores.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: shnewb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta for 1 night to catch an early morning flight. The room was ok. Nothing fancy but I didn't expect it for $65. There is a flat screen tv in addition to a desk for your computer with free Wi-Fi. The bathroom is a bit small. Amenities include all in one shampoo/conditioner and a hair dryer. There is a small coffee pot too. The bed and pillows were comfy. The walls are paper thin so don't expect to get much sleep. You can hear people talking as they pass outside your door as well as the water running in the shower in the adjacent room. The noise above us was worse so make sure you ask for the top floor! You must make a reservation for the airport shuttle. It leaves every 20 minutes and makes a stop at another La Quinta about a block away. They just acquired this La Quinta so that's why there are 2 of them so close together. As promised, we made it to the airport in about 12 minutes. The staff is super friendly. The continental breakfast includes make your own waffles, cereal, hard boiled eggs, bagels, muffins, bread for toast and packets of instant oatmeal. All in all, it was pretty good--beats nothing! Drinks included coffee, water, milk, apple and orange juice. I probably wouldn't stay here again due to the noise factor. I would probably spend the extra money in order to get a good night's sleep at a more higher rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking...YEAH RIGHT”
Reviews.Author: Law_Chick_2600
Reviews.Content: Called and made my reservation on the phone and specifically told them that I would be parking my car there for a week. I specifically asked if there was free parking. Every time I talked to them they said "Yes, free parking". Get to the hotel...guess what...they want to charge me for parking! They told me that I needed to purchase the "stay and go" package...otherwise they're going to charge me $5.00/day for parking. My room went from $53.10 to $72.00+tax...a grand total of $92! HUGE PRICE DIFFERENCE! I was forced to purchase the room because it was already late and my flight left at 6 a.m. so I had to eat the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Indy 500”
Reviews.Author: MrsPais
Reviews.Content: We went to Indianapolis to see Indy 500 and we totaly recommend this hotel. The hotel has a very good location next to Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Rooms are good, very clean and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: msditty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for 1 night stay. We stayed here since we had an early AM flight out the next day. The room was clean, the staff helpful, the complimentary breakfast was one of the better ones we have seen and it was ready at 4am! They do offer a park and shuttle service to the airport but we didn't use this service. There is a resturant in the parking lot Indy Family Resturant. We ate there since it was close and easy. They give you a 10% discount if you show your hotel key. The food was good and fairly priced. The price to stay here compared to the other hotels in the area for our purpose, this was exceptional. I would stay here again on our travels out Indy International Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: vikesfan
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very acceptable for a 1 night stay at least. The room was large and relatively clean, although the bathroom was tiny. It is a tad bit tricky to find as there is another La Quinta literally just blocks away and my GPS directed me there instead of to the correct hotel. The continental breakfast was also adequate and the breakfast area was nice and clean. It was not noisy as suggested by previous reviewers however we stayed there on a weeknight - it might be noisier on the weekends possibly. Overall, we had a fine stay for 1 night passing thru Indianapolis. Rate was also exceptionally good at $49 per night for AAA.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: jaywalker17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Indy 500 weekend with 3 of my cousins. While not the worst hotel I've stayed at in Indianapolis, I'd never stay here again. Started off with our room, paid for in full at time of booking, which was supposed to be non-smoking. Front desk informed us that non-smoking was just a request, and they were out of non-smoking rooms. No apology. Ick. Room itself was just ok. Bathroom door lock didn't work. Slight smell of smoke, but not terrible. Beds were not the most comfortable. Towels worn down to nothing. And we found a bug in one of the beds. Free Breakfast had little to offer. no fruit. Cereal, hard boiled eggs (a huge jar of them...how long were they there?), Orange juice was gone by 8:30am. They did have 2 waffle makers, both of which were dirty when we went to eat. Bagels were wrapped in plastic wrap, meaning they were kept day to day, not fresh. Ick again. Noise was a problem. Thin walls! People talking in the hallway or next room sounded like they were right next to you. Pool area was small, but clean. Staff was functional without being friendly. Location was convient to the race track.

Reviews.Title: “vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: kandvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Aug of 08 for a trip to Florida. Had a good experience. Stayed again on Jan 30th for a flight to Vegas. Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast is OK, nothing special. Just like everyone else's. Did the stay and go package to leave our car there. Upon check-in, they ask your flight time for next day and schedule shuttle for you. Staff is friendly and courteous. You are about 20 minutes from the new airport. On return flight, got into Indy about 12am. Called for shuttle, but was told they didn't have any at that time of the night. They call you a taxi to get you and take you to the hotel. They paid the taxi fee,and it took about 15 minutes from the time we got to baggae claim , called and got picked up. Wasn't bad at all. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great price, nice room”
Reviews.Author: grande_rosso
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 1 night here in September (rm 124). Clean, fairly new carpet, nice king bed, clean bathroom. Great value for $50 a night

Reviews.Title: “2**”
Reviews.Author: pupster2
Reviews.Content: more like a 2star not 2.5. would only stay at a discounted rate. The rooms are kind of musty&smokey.

Reviews.Title: “Midnight, Raining, and I left Key West...is this purgatory or that other place?”
Reviews.Author: justthatgoodguyjim
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Hotwire with the understanding that I was going to arrive after midnight and be gone by 9 am the next morning. The fact that I hadn't been to church since Christmas didn't cross my mind but perhaps that had a play in my experience. Karma is a son of a gun. I needed directions to the airport and the front desk person was awesome. She took the guess work out of my lack of planning. Check in was quick and painless. I saw a bunch of semi trucks parked out front but it didn't occur to me at the time this was at all relevant. Ahhh...but opening the door a well worn carpet that resembled a path diverging into the woods told me this room was definitely not less traveled. Tossing my bag onto one of the beds, I couldn't but help notice the mattresses reminded me of a cellophane wrapped airport sandwich. Had I come in a few hours later, I could've made up a stack of belgian waffles in the lobby and doubled the thickness of my evening magic carpet to fly me to Dream Land. To my chagrin, the alarm clock woke me up at the precise moment I set it. The complimentary plastic bottles of shampoo worked their charm. I'm not sure who did the patch work porcelain work in the tub but it looked like the worker finished minutes before Immigration came knocking. Bounding out of the room to the lobby, my check out was quick and tidy. The breakfast lobby looked like a family truck stop. No fresh fruit here, Billy Bob! The begian waffle maker was a popular draw. Yogurt, truck stop style coffee, and plastic embalmed sweet rolls beckoned as well. It was a cheap room for a quick snooze. Knock off a half star and it's a good descriptor. Add fresh fruit to the breakfast spread and I'll spot you that half star. Don't change the staff, change the matteresses and clean the carpet. It'll be three-star in no time!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: natrat
Reviews.Content: Got hotel on hotwire as 2.5 star offer with breakfast. Hotel lobby looked newly done and clean. Breakfast area was clean. Rooms were ok but a little worn. Coffeemaker looked like it hadn't been used and had some dust at the bottom of the water reservoir but otherwise linen, etc looked clean. Heating unit had a noisy fan.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this one”
Reviews.Author: Lungfruit
Reviews.Content: La Quinta's vary in quality and this one ranks at the bottom of the quality scale. We've stayed at at least 5 different La Quinta's because they are usually a good bargain but I wouldn't stay at this one again. I didn't get a chance to check this one on Trip Advisor but I wish I could have. The hotel was packed due to the Good Guys being in town and the flooding in southern Indiana trapped alot of people at the airport. This wasn't too big a deal as the hotel was quiet but we couldn't get the room we had booked and had to settle for the tiniest hotel room we've ever stayed in. It was a no smoking that smelled of smoke. The two twin beds were about all that fit in the room. The bathroom was like a dorm bath - small and falling apart. The linens had holes and the towels were impossibly threadbare. I don't know how they stayed together. Lastly the "secure exit" was yanked open by housekeeping when they were done with their smoke break. Not very secure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Motel!”
Reviews.Author: deadendangel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night of May 7. We had flown in and didn't have a flight out to Chicago until the next day. We called the hotel shuttle when we landed and they were there to pick us up very promptly. When we checked in, we asked to be put on the shuttle schedule for the morning and it was again on time and enjoyable. As for the room, we were more than satisfied. It was a double room, very clean, spacious, with a large table and 2 chairs, also they have internet hookup in the room, didn't have a laptop so we didn't use it, but they do have a computer in the lobby area with printer that was very accessible. Beds were comfortable, the only thing I would say negative is the sheets and blanket were very thin, but very clean. The staff were VERY courteous and friendly, went out of their way to answer any questions we had about where to eat that night. We ate at Indy's Restaurant that was right next door. In the morning they have a continental breakfast with make your own waffles, cereals, fruit, rolls, yogurt, bagels, all kinds of drinks. It's in a little area with TV, pretty average for motels now I guess, but the waffles were a nice touch. All in all we had a very pleasurable stay and would definitely stay here again. The price ($58 AARP rate) is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marco123
Reviews.Content: Not clean. Old. Non-Smoking smelled strongly of smoke. Staff was not pleasant. Not a great location, but not tht thrilled with Indianapolis in any way, so par for the city. Cheap hotel, but in this case you only get what you pay for, and that is not alot.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice and Go Prepared”
Reviews.Author: B1J2
Reviews.Content: I regret our stay at this hotel and am glad it was only one night. Upon arrival the attendant was very short and did not even give us directions to our room. Note: they where not busy. We were traveling with small children and needed 2 rooms connected or side by side, which I had discussed with them directly at the time of making prior reservations. Our rooms were 6 rooms apart and was told that was the best they could do. A room a few doors down had a horrible smell coming from it. they had professional cleaners working on it. They were wearing masks and rubber gloves. The cleaners said that the day before the smell was even worse. We had to keep the doors closed to prevent the smell from getting in. I can't imagine what went on in their. The hotel was completly out of ice and all vending machines were empty. We were told to go across to a gas station for drinks. I remind you this is in Indianapolis at night. The rooms where not that clean but I have seen worse. Praise: The complimentry breakfast was very good. Hot and cold choices including fruits and juices. The bus shuttle to the airport was very prompt and the driver very nice. The return bus shuttle was also very promt and nice.

Reviews.Title: “You Cant Pay me enough to stay here Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yuck!!!! Thats all I can say !!!!! This place is filthy!!!! The staff is very, very unfriendly!!! I will never stay at another La Quinta Ever !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic! Great find at time of need!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They must have renovated the hotel. It was terrific. I've never slept better at a hotel. My bed was SO comfortable and the pillows were great too. They had high speed internet in the rooms. The staff was super nice (I had to convert from a different hotel at Midnight...and they made sure I was comfy.) The breakfast was great...plenty of choices including a fresh waffle station! Great price and great room. The only issue was hearing people through the door, but otherwise a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but older property”
Reviews.Author: breichel
Reviews.Content: A bit rundown and there was an ant problem in the bathroom. Servicable stop if you need to stay close to the airport. They allow long term parking on their lot for free, which was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We flew out of the Indianapolis Airport because of the major savings on our flight to San Juan, and needed to stay there 1 night. So we were going to need to park our car in a pay lot. I found La Quinta and they offer free parking. Up to 14 days!!! Amazing Deluxe Continental Breakfasts...homemade waffels, cereals, bagels with fruity cream cheese...not the normal Continental Breakfast! Rooms were spacious, clean, and the lobby area felt like the management took care of their hotel! No worries about staying at this hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Indianapolis Airport Lynhurst
HotelInfo.Address: 5316 West Southern Ave., Indianapolis, IN 46241-5510
